battle_script_strings.string: Aizu lies at the end of the pass, my lord! We must proceed with caution!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: My Lord! The Aizu send the Azure Dragons against us!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Commander! The Black Tortoise force is sighted!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: My Lord, we are under attack by the Vermillion Bird regiment!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The White Tigers my Lord! They move to strike against us!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The Aizu are defeated! Now they will learn the price of resisting the Emperor!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Our army is beaten! May the Shogun show us mercy!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Lord Takamori has fallen! Panic grips our men! Retreat!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: My Lord, we are lost! Retreat!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: My Lord, our armies lie separated and the Ezo move against us! We are in great danger!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: By your great skill the Ezo advance is defeated! Press on, and take Hakodate castle!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Hakodate is captured! My Lord, you have done it! The Ezo Republic is crushed, and all of Japan belongs to the Emperor once again!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: French troops, my lord! They train the Ezo soldiers and defend the castle!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Enemy ships sighted, Admiral! We must protect the Kotetsu! To battle!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The Kotetsu is coming under fire Commander!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Admiral, the Kotetsu is taking heavy damage! We must protect her!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The Kotetsu is being boarded! To her aid, quickly!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The captain of the Kotetsu reports that her engines are repaired sir, and can join the battle!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Admiral, coastal artillery crews stand ready to fire, and await your orders!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Admiral, the Kotetsu is lost! We have failed!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: A terrible day! Defeat is our burden to bear.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The Kotetsu is saved! The Ezo navy has scattered! A great triumph!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Artillery emplacements ring the bay, and would greatly add to our firepower. Capture them!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: More enemy ships sighted, sir!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Lord Takamori, the road to Osaka Castle is lightly defended! Claim it for the Emperor!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: A ruse! The defenders have blown the drawbridge, our path is blocked! Where are they keeping the gunpowder?
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Another bridge destroyed! What fools we are!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: My Lord, we hit a gunpowder store! The defenders must flee from the castle!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: My Lord! Cavalry!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The defenders flee! Osaka castle is ours! For the Emperor!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Shogunate units approach! Our orders are to prevent them reaching Kyoto to the north-west! Block their exit from the battlefield!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: We've been given the slip, commander! Chase these men down before they can march on Kyoto!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: An enemy unit has evaded our blockade sir! Our mission is failed!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The shogun’s advance has been broken! His men flee in disarray!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Daylight is failing and the enemy are setting up camp nearby. Let us do likewise.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Now we fly the Imperial banner. Our enemy lose the will to fight! Crush them!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The Shogunate army has been scattered! We are victorious!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Arrows on the radar map show possible escape routes to Kyoto.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The enemy defend locations in the temple complex my lord! Drive them out!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Our reinforcements are delayed! No matter: we must push through the enemy defences!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Finally! Our reinforcements are on the battlefield!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Kan’ei-ji temple is ours my lord! We are victorious!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Aizu, a domain in the north of Japan, has been home to stalwart supporters of the Shogunate since the beginning of the war.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: They are the cornerstone of northern resistance.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Saigo Takamori’s dream of restoring the Emperor depends upon this resistance being eliminated.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The Imperial army is approaching from the east, and Takamori must bring this force through the mountains.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: He knows the pass will be heavily defended.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The Aizu defenders are divided into four groupings. The exact locations of these forces are unknown.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Takamori must overcome whatever traps the Aizu defenders have set to win the north for his Emperor!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Saigo Takamori has dedicated his life to restoring the power of the Emperor.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: With victory at Aizu, the entire Japanese mainland has been conquered in this cause.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Despite the abdication of the Tokugawa Shogun and the capitulation of the northern lords, there are still a few loyal to the Shogunate’s cause.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: These loyalist die-hards are retreating north. There is now a so-called Republic on the island of Ezo.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: These men know that control of the sea is vital to repel the Imperial government.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: However the Imperial navy has just taken delivery of a new ironclad warship, the Kotetsu.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The rebels of Ezo know that it is stationed in Miyako Bay on Japan’s north-east coast, and they mean to steal it!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The Ezo Republic has failed in their attempt to capture the Kotetsu, and the coast of Ezo Island is defenceless.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Takamori gathers the Imperial army for one final attack, one last battle, to defeat the Tokugawa loyalists.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The Ezo defenders dig in at Hakodate to make a final stand.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Following the destruction of Osaka castle Shogun Tokugawa Yoshinobu returns to Edo by sea.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: His army is smashed. Japan is in turmoil.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Support for the Shogunate in central and southern Japan has collapsed. Clans flock to the Emperor’s banner.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Imperial forces march across central Japan facing only token resistance.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Tokugawa Yoshinobu, with insufficient manpower to defend Edo, surrenders the city and his position.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Some loyalist Shogunate troops, however, refuse to surrender.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: At Ueno, near Edo, a loyalist army digs in. They must be removed.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Any pretence of diplomacy is now no more than clouds on the wind. Civil war engulfs the land.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The forces loyal to the Tokugawa Shogunate have been pushed back to Osaka Castle.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The Satsuma and Choshu clans, led by Saigo Takamori, march on Osaka, ready for battle.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: With the loyalist defeat at Ueno, central and southern Japan are now united under the Imperial banner.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Shogun Tokugawa Yoshinobu has retired and his capital, now renamed Tokyo, is firmly under the Emperor’s control.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: In the north of the country however, an alliance of domains still oppose the revolution and the Imperial army.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Forces from Aizu oppose the Imperial advance at every turn.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Saigo Takamori resolves to snuff out any remaining resistance!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The last of the Tokugawa loyalists are entrenched on Ezo Island.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: They are preparing to make their final stand around a modern star fort built just a few years previously.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Saigo Takamori’s long journey to restore Imperial power and prestige will end here.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: However, his fleet became spread out during the crossing from the mainland.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Takamori’s forces are now split, scattered along the Ezo coast.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The loyalist army see an opportunity to strike, and advance.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Saigo Takamori now finds himself on the defensive.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: He must weather the assault and then unite his army before Hakodate Castle can be taken!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The mainland is now firmly under Imperial control.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: However to the North Shogunate loyalists have established a breakaway “Ezo Republic”.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The Republic controls a good proportion of the former Shogunate navy.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: At sea, then, the sides are evenly matched. The Imperial navy, though, has a new weapon.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The Kotetsu, a state-of-the-art ironclad warship, is more advanced by far than any ship in the Ezo navy.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The Ezo have launched a daring raid to capture or sink the ironclad.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The Kotetsu is trapped in Miyako Bay, protected by a small Imperial flotilla.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Her engines are undergoing maintenance, and will take time to reassemble. Until then she cannot move or fire!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Repel the Ezo navy, and protect the Kotetsu!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The Ezo raid on Miyako Bay has failed.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Imperial losses have been heavy, but the Kotetsu survives.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Now, at the Emperor’s command, she will cut a path to Ezo!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Only a few days have passed since war broke out at Toba-Fushimi.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The fearsome samurai Saigo Takamori and his Imperial army are marching against the Tokugawa shogun himself.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Tokugawa Yoshinobu’s seat is Osaka Castle, a formidable fortress surrounded by water.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The scattered Tokugawa loyalists have regrouped here. They defend the town and castle in great numbers.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Takamori’s scouts report that Shogunate troops have been spotted moving large amounts of gunpowder.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The activity seems to be centred on the wall towers of the castle. Perhaps they are storing it there?
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The scouts also report that Tokugawa Yoshinobu himself has fled by ship. The Shogun will have to watch his castle burn!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Defeat the Shogunate army. Capture Osaka castle, and burn it as a demonstration of the Emperor’s wrath!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: From a ship in Osaka bay, Tokugawa Yoshinobu watches his castle burn.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: He has now been driven from the southern half of a country he supposedly rules.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Through courageous leadership in battle, Saigo Takamori has tipped the balance of power in Japan.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: His samurai followers see him as a hero, and his achievements are celebrated throughout the land.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: It is a time of great political tension in Japan.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The Tokugawa shogunate is in turmoil.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The Satsuma and Choshu clans have rallied to the Emperor in a bid to restore his power.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Their troops mass in the Imperial capital, Kyoto, in an effort to intimidate the political classes.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: They are led by Saigo Takamori, a samurai from Satsuma province.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Respected throughout Japan for his honour and integrity, Takamori believes passionately in the Emperor’s cause.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: He is prepared to fight to see the Emperor restored to political prominence, as in former days.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: He stretches the patience of the Shogun, and now it has snapped.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: From his base in Osaka castle Shogun Tokugawa Yoshinobu has sent a letter to the Emperor’s court detailing Takamori's treachery.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: To ensure that the letter reaches the Emperor, Yoshinobu has sent his army to deliver it.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Saigo Takamori has no intention of letting the Shogun's army reach Kyoto.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: He has blocked the road at Toba and Fushimi.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: And so war has come! Your task is to prevent the Shogunate army from reaching Kyoto!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The Shogun’s army has been thrown back after a day of heavy fighting.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: He still maintains a significant force and now his sword is fully drawn.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: There is no pretence of anything but open battle.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: However, the victory of the Choshu and Satsuma forces has brought political gains overnight.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: They now have support from nearby Kyoto, including from the Emperor’s relatives.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Saigo Takamori and his allies are united under the Imperial banner!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The Shogunate army now see that they defy the will of the Emperor! Drive them from the battlefield!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Political manoeuvring and military tension have become full-scale war.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Saigo Takamori has won a great victory in the Emperor’s name.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The Shogunate army are in full retreat to Osaka castle, the seat of the Shogun himself.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The Imperial forces give chase, and the war goes on!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Confronted by the might of the Imperial army, Shogun Tokugawa Yoshinobu has surrendered Edo and his authority.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Saigo Takamori is succeeding in his quest to restore the powers of the Emperor.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: He is now the most celebrated samurai in all Japan.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Despite the resignation of the Shogun, some troops around Edo are still loyal to his cause.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: They hold out in Kan’ei-ji temple on Ueno hill, to the north-east of the city.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: They are dug in around the temple complex, and must be removed by force.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Saigo Takamori’s plan is for a frontal attack, supported by reinforcements from the west.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: He knows that the attack will face heavy resistance and insists on leading the main assault.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Takamori’s imposing presence on the battlefield could be crucial in achieving victory today.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Victory at Ueno is the end of Shogunate resistance in central Japan.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Saigo Takamori has now all but assured the restoration of the Emperor to his rightful role as ruler of Japan.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: September, 1868
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Objective: Defeat the Aizu defenders.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Bonari Pass, Aizu domain
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Objective: Keep Saigo Takamori alive.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Objective: Defeat the Ezo defenders and capture Hakodate castle.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Hakodate, Ezo Island
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: May 6th, 1869
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Objective: Defend the Kotetsu.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Miyako Bay, north-east Japan
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: February 2nd, 1868
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Objective: Capture Osaka Castle.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Osaka
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: January 27th, 1868
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: January 28th, 1868
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Objective: Prevent any shogunate units from breaking through to Kyoto.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Objective: Defeat the shogunate army.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Fushimi, near Kyoto
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: July 4th, 1868
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Objective: defeat the loyalist army.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Kan’ei-ji Temple, near Edo
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: My Lord, the Oda clan retreat! We must do likewise! This battle is lost!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The Asai and Asakura are crushed! All of Japan will surely tremble as the Oda and Tokugawa march onwards!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Commander! Lord Nobunaga is engaging the enemy, and requests us to cross the river to support his attack!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: My Lord! Dreadful news! Lord Nobunaga has fallen! His men break their spears in grief!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: My Lord! Word has come that the Asai commander is in retreat towards the castle. Defeat his army, and they will be surrounded!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The Oda have committed their reserves to battle! We should assist where we can!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Our opponents fall before us, yet the Oda face more resistance. Perhaps we should send men to their aid!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The Asai flee in disarray! Nagamasa is trapped in his fortress!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: He is not without honour: Asai Nagamasa has released Lady Oichi from the castle. She is safe!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The Oda will assault the castle from the south.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The Tokugawa must strike from the west.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Continue with the attack!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Daimyo! Lord Nobunaga requests that you focus your attacks on the left, while he takes the right. Engage the enemy rockets!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: This is the province of Omi. The year is 1570.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Oda Nobunaga and Tokugawa Ieyasu are marching north, along the eastern shore of Lake Biwa.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Nobunaga means to fight Asai Nagamasa, his brother-in-law, and Nagamasa’s allies, the Asakura clan, who have plotted against him.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The Asai and Asakura armies are in a defensive position along the Anegawa river.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Their position blocks the plain beneath the Asai's most formidable fortress, Odani castle.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Watching the battle from the castle above will be Nagamasa's father, Asai Hisamasa. Oda Nobunaga's sister, Oichi, is also in the castle. Nobunaga wants her back.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Oda Nobunaga knows that he has the Asai cornered. If he defeats them there will be no escape for anyone in Odani castle.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: He has split the allied army: the Oda will meet the Asai on the right; on the left the Tokugawa will face the Asakura.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: If his battle plan works, then the two wings should attack Odani castle from either side.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Tokugawa Ieyasu is confident and knows that his army will play a crucial role in today’s victory.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Objective: Attack the enemy across the river on the left while the Oda attack on the right
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Objective: Capture Odani castle
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Kawagoe, our home, is lost. This is deeply shameful!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Victory is yours, my lord! The enemy is broken! A fitting doom has befallen the Uesugi!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: My lord! Our ninja are dead! We can no long attack at the same time as the relieving force.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Success, my lord, success! Our ninja have met the relieving force. A co-ordinated attack can happen soon.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: I suggest we send archers to the palisades. They will be deadly to any approaching foes.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: I would suggest blocking open gateways with yari. Line the walls with Archers. Our enemies will flee!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: This is Kawagoe Castle. The year is 1545.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Our Hojo fortress is completely surrounded by the army of Ogigayatsu Tomosada, a scion of the Uesugi clan.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Our forces are outnumbered, but there may yet be hope. Word has come that a Hojo army is marching to relieve the siege.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Even better, the besieging forces seem so confident of victory that they are not keeping a proper watch.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: We must hold out until reinforcements arrive. Then our clan brothers can deal a deadly blow to the besieging army.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Stand strong my brother. Victory awaits us on the horizon!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Objective: Successfully defend Kawagoe castle against the Uesugi
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Objective: Inform relieving forces of the attack without being spotted
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Defeat? No! A setback! There is always a chance to fight again! And the day will come when we have victory!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Finally! Complete victory! What we craved is ours! The Takeda will think twice about entering Shinano!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: My lord, look! Takeda troops are at the river crossing on our flank!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: For eight years and three battles Uesugi Kenshin struggled against Takeda Shingen. They met for the fourth time on the Hachimanbara plain in Kawanakajima.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Reliable spies had informed Uesugi Kenshin of movement within the Takeda castle during the night before the battle.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Takeda Shingen split his army in two, believing this to be a secret. He would lead one-third of his men down onto the plain during the night.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The remainder, under the command of his leading general, were to climb Mount Saijosan, where the Uesugi were camped, to catch them unawares and drive them down onto the plain and onto the waiting spears of Takeda's men.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Lord Uesugi, as always, proved to be Takeda Shingen's equal. During the night he silently marched onto the plain. He now had the advantage as he moved against the unsuspecting Takeda army.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: With Takeda Shingen's army divided and superior Uesugi numbers on the plain, victory for Uesugi Kenshin was now a clear possibility.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Objective: Defeat the Takeda army
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: My Lord! The battle is lost! I fear the temple of Ishiyama Hongan-ji will fall without supplies!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Despite the impressive strength of the enemy we have achieved a glorious victory!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: This is the Kizu River in 1578. Two years after losing an earlier battle, Admiral Kuki Yoshitaka of the Oda clan, has returned. His task is to break the supply lines to Ishiyama Hongan-ji, the cathedral-fortress under siege by Oda Nobunaga, his daimyo.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Yoshitaka has come with six huge O Ataka Bune warships. Among the crew are many seasoned matchlock ashigaru, survivors of the bloody battle here two years ago.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The defending fleet, led by Murakami Takayoshi, a Mori admiral, is more used to fighting with conventional ships.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Although weaker, these ships are faster and more agile than the Oda vessels. They are the only hope for a Mori victory against the superior Oda force.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The Oda fleet's overwhelming strength looks almost certain to defeat the Mori! Almost…
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Objective: Defeat the Oda fleet
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: We are lost! Defeat embraces us! The fortress has burned, and the sect with it!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The dog Nobunaga and his Oda army have been put to flight! The fortress is burned, but we are still masters of this land!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: My Lord! The fortifications are ablaze, and the fire is spreading! This is the moment to break this siege!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The cannon! Turn the cannon on our own towers to stop the fire spreading!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Sir! This cursed inferno is beginning to catch our men! Let them sally forth, and make that dog Nobunaga pay in blood!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: My Lord! Your men are dying in the flames! We must escape before we all burn to death!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Some of your men have become encircled by fire! Their escape is barred, they are lost!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: It is 1574, and Oda Nobunaga is laying siege to the Ikko-Ikki fortress at Nagashima.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: This is his third attempt to reduce the island citadel.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Sited in a river delta on the border of Ise and Owari provinces, the fortress has been a thorn in Nobunaga's side for years.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Stung by his previous failures to capture the stronghold, the warlord has now brought all his forces to bear against the Ikko-Ikki.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Nagashima is completely surrounded. There is no escape, by either land or sea.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Nobunaga's plan does not anticipate surrender. Nor does he anticipate survivors.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The Oda have set fire to the fortress from the outside. In the strong winds, the fire should take hold quickly.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The Ikko-Ikki must fight their way out of the castle before they burn to death inside!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Objective: Escape from Nagashima Castle
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Objective: Defeat the Oda army
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: My Lord, our army is in flight! Nagashino Castle will surely fall! We are defeated!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The Takeda have been swept from the field, and are fleeing to the mountains! The siege is broken! A glorious victory!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The Takeda are advancing, soon their horses will be upon us. We must defend the palisades!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The relief forces are in position Daimyo! Combine them with your main army and relieve the siege of Nagashino!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The Takeda are storming the castle! Now is the time to aid the garrison!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The castle garrison will surely fall soon! Hurry, and break the siege!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The castle is lost my lord! Shame and dishonour are the price we must pay for our failure here!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: It is June, 1575, and Nagashino Castle in Mikawa province is under attack.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: After an incursion deep into Tokugawa territory failed, Takeda Katsuyori led his army back into the mountains and now besieges the fortress at Nagashino.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: He can count among his forces the fearsome Takeda cavalry, known to be the finest in Japan.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The young Takeda warlord is keen to be successful in his attack on Nagashino after the failure of his raid so far.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: However, word has now reached Tokugawa Ieyasu that his castle is under attack. The Tokugawa are not without powerful friends.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Oda Nobunaga, the foremost warlord in central Japan, has brought his army to relieve the siege.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Among his army are his many matchlock gunners. Nobunaga means to deploy these gunners behind wooden palisades alongside regular infantry, all to protect them from the Takeda cavalry.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: However, Nobunaga knows that his defensive position is unlikely to save the Nagashino garrison.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: He has sent a flanking army into the hills to the south. Once the Takeda are defeated at the palisades, the flanking force will be able to relieve the castle.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The Oda therefore have two battles to win: they must repel the Takeda cavalry at their defensive line, and also relieve Nagashino Castle before it falls.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: He has positioned his army along the banks of a fordable stream. Crossing the stream will slow the Takeda cavalry's momentum as they come into firing range.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Objective: The flanking force is in position! Use them and your main army to stop the Takeda from capturing Nagashino Castle!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Objective: Defeat the main Takeda army
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Defeated? Yes! But surrender? Never!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: This victory will long be remembered as the moment when all Japan learned of our worth!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Our camp is being attacked! To arms! Alert everyone!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: To arms, all! To arms!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Nobunaga attacks! Protect Lord Yoshimoto.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The gorge is surrounded by Nobunaga’s army! Alert the camp.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: My Lord, beware! The enemy has seen us and is going to the camp for help!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: My Lord, beware! The enemy has found the bodies of their warriors and are going back to their camp for help!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: What’s going on? What’s the racket? QUIET!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Imagawa Yoshimoto arrived at Okehazama with greater forces than Oda Nobunaga.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The Imagawa arrived in such numbers that several of Lord Nobunaga’s advisors pleaded with him to surrender, an option he refused to consider.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Yoshimoto was so confident of victory that he allowed his men to celebrate before the battle.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Lord Nobunaga led his men to the gorge with the Imagawa camp, but he ordered a small force to stay behind in the Oda camp. They were to put up many flags, to mislead Yoshimoto.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: As Nobunaga watched the Imagawa, good fortune came to his aid: a rain storm began.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The storm, and the Imagawa revelries, set the stage for a decisive attack that would go down in Japanese history as a pivotal moment.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Objective: Kill all the camp patrols
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The plan is to move the army around to the north of the camp and then attack from there.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: First, however, we must clear Yoshimoto’s patrols in the forest.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: For surprise and speed, we shall use only the cavalry.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: When the patrols are gone we will attack the camp! Our target is Yoshimoto’s tent!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: We can – we must – reach the tent and kill Yoshimoto before the Imagawa realise what is happening!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Objective: Reach Yoshimoto’s tent and kill him
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Now that the patrols are gone, attack the camp.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Remember our target is Yoshimoto! Take his head!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: What chance was there with traitors at our side? Shimazu, Mori, Hideaki: Curse their names! Now the Tokugawa cannot be stopped!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Despite betrayal, we have crushed Ieyasu once and for all. The Toyotomi clan and name will live on.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: My Lord, the Shimazu will not commit to battle. Apparently, a messenger has offended their honour by not dismounting when delivering a message.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: My Lord! We are betrayed! Lord Hideaki has joined forces with the Tokugawa and is now charging down the mountain towards us!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Your messenger insults me! He should dismount before speaking!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: In this battle each unit must look to its affairs and fight its own battle with all its might. There is no time to be concerned with the others in front, behind, or on either flank.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Lord Mitsunari arrived at Sekigahara before Lord Ieyasu and camped on Mount Sasao.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: During the night, Ieyasu's men made the difficult journey around Mount Nangu and entered Sekigahara, all the while hidden by a heavy mist.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Such was the mist that leading units on both sides accidentally, and briefly clashed.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: As the mist burned away I could see Lord Ieyasu’s command post set up at the foot of Mount Nangu. His men took their positions on the battlefield.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Lord Mitsunari's ally, Lord Hiroie, awaits on the far side of Mount Nangu with his vast army. His family has been slighted by Lord Mitsunari, so his participation in battle is not a certainty.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: The young lord Hideaki has taken an excellent position on Mount Matsuo. However there are rumours of a plot by Hideaki to betray Lord Mitsunari.
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: I, Otani Yoshitsugu, have placed my troops in front of Lord Hideaki's force. I am concerned that other betrayals and insults will bear fruit: will Lord Shimazu fight, after the insults he endured from Lord Mitsunari? Only time will tell!
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: Objective: Defeat the Tokugawa army
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder

battle_script_strings.string: This is the E3 Battle
battle_script_strings.title: placeholder
